Identification.ShortTitle: Ontario Greenhouse Vegetable Marketing (Interprovincial and Export) Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Marketing in Interprovincial and Export Trade of Greenhouse Vegetables Produced in Ontario

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Ontario Greenhouse Vegetable Marketing (Interprovincial and Export) Regulations.

Definition.Text: appointed shipper means a shipper in possession of a valid and subsisting certificate of appointment issued by the Commodity Board pursuant to the Ontario Greenhouse Vegetable Appointed Shippers’ Procedures (Interprovincial and Export) Regulations; (expéditeur désigné)
Commodity Board means The Ontario Greenhouse Vegetable Producers’ Marketing Board; (Office de commercialisation)

greenhouse vegetables means tomatoes, cucumbers and lettuce produced in the Province of Ontario in a greenhouse or any other enclosure under glass, plastic or other material used for the purpose of controlling temperature and providing protection for growing plants; (légumes de serre)
producer means a person engaged in the production of greenhouse vegetables; (producteur)
product means any quantity of greenhouse vegetables; (produit)
retailer means any person who sells or offers to sell a product directly to the consumer and includes the operator of a roadside stand; (détaillant)
shipper means any person who offers for sale, sells, receives, assembles, packs, ships for sale or transports a product but does not include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a servant employed by and driving a vehicle owned by a producer or an appointed shipper,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person who transports the product by motor vehicle as agent of the producer; (expéditeur)

Definition.Text: wholesaler means a person who buys a product through the Commodity Board and who offers for sale or sells the product to a retailer. (grossiste)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the marketing of a product in interprovincial and export trade;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: persons and property situated in the Province of Ontario; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a product produced in the Counties of Essex, Kent and Lambton in the Province of Ontario.

Section.Text: A producer who sells a product directly to a consumer or a consumer who buys a product directly from a producer is, in respect of that product, exempt from these Regulations.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a producer who sells or offers for sale a product through the Commodity Board,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesaler who buys a product through the Commodity Board for resale, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a producer authorized under a licence issued by the Commodity Board to sell or offer for sale a product

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall sell the product or offer the product for sale.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesaler who buys a product through the Commodity Board for resale in the normal course of his business, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a retailer who buys a product through the Commodity Board or from a wholesaler for resale in the normal course of his business

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an appointed shipper who ships a product for a producer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesaler who buys a product through the Commodity Board for resale in the normal course of his business,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a producer authorized to transport a product under a licence issued by the Commodity Board

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an appointed shipper who ships a product for a producer,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a wholesaler who buys a product through the Commodity Board for resale in the normal course of his business, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a producer authorized to ship a product under a licence issued by the Commodity Board

Subsection.Text: A licence may be issued to a producer by the Commodity Board to sell, transport or ship a product otherwise than through the Commodity Board.
A licence issued pursuant to subsection (1) shall expire on December 31st of the year for which the licence is issued.
